content: in this video I want to review some Hayabusa hand wraps for boxing and MMA and I also want to show you my favorite way to wrap my hands so let's hop to it first things first there's lots of different hand wraps to choose from and there's not a whole lot you can do two hand wraps to really make them stand out you know one from the other in my opinion that being said the Hayabusa hand wraps do have a few features that I really dig and so in the future I'll get more of those instead of more of these these are the elastic hand wraps some people prefer just the plain cotton ones because there's not stretch or give I personally like the elasticy ones because I feel like you can fine-tune how tight or loose they are a little bit better oh one more thing I learned this method of hand wrapping from a YouTube video made by Pentagon MMA so a big shout-out to you guys thanks for making quality content and I'm gonna link to that video somewhere in this video so over here somewhere check it out ok first things first you're going to unwrap your hand wraps all the way when you get to the end you're gonna see a loop like that and you're gonna see something that is unique to Hayabusa something I love it's a little note that says this end up so I can see that this side up this side up some rap companies don't have that note and what happens is if you accidentally wrap your hand the opposite way you'll get to the end of the wrap and you go to secure it with the velcro but the velcro is on the other side and it's very annoying because you just wasted a couple minutes maybe you're you're going to a training session you need to get there on time you just wrapped your hands and now you can't secure them and you just look a little dumb so Hayabusa once again thanks for making me look less dumb I really like this small little feature that makes my life so much better if you're watching this thank you okay so hand wrapping this is a closed palm system so you're going to start with your palm facing down and this side up facing up you're gonna put the loop around your thumb and you're going to start by wrapping your wrist three times one two three now some people like their wraps tight other people like them loose I like them kind of in the middle and once again the fact that these are elastic lets me control that a little bit more in order to figure out what you like whether you like it loose or tight you're just gonna have to do it you know wrap your hands go spar go hit a bag and just figure out what works best for you a little cautionary you know if you go too tight it's gonna cut blood circulation off to your hands and it's gonna get really uncomfortable so just keep that in mind okay so once you have gone around your wrist three times you're gonna go around your thumb over the top of your thumb boom just like that and then you're gonna go back around your wrist okay so over your thumb and back around your wrist and now what you can see is that the hand wrap is starting to creep up the backside of your hand a bit more think of this as a high-top shoe so when you put put your foot in a high-top shoe the high-top supports the ankle joint right so these hand wraps are doing just that as you creep up the top of your hand you're really wrapping the wrist joint and it's going to support the wrist as it starts hitting a bag pads a person and it's gonna help fight that force that gets put on the wrist then you're going to go around the wrist again and you're going to make half an X go and even higher up your palm then it helps to spread your palm out and then you go three times around the palm one two three now notice you know your rap will get bunched up on the floor and you really have to just lift it up to unravel it it's a little bit helpful once you go around your wrist three times you're gonna go and complete this X so you already went this way now you want to come back that way so you're gonna go around your wrist the other way and that X really creates that support for your wrist joint then you're gonna go around your wrist again and now you're gonna start going in between each finger so pinky ring finger first just like that I'm a bit of a perfectionist when I first started to do this I tried very hard to keep the wrap straight but the crease in between the fingers is a lot smaller than the actual thickness of the wrap and it's going to crease there's nothing you can do the important thing here is that the crease be comfortable so as you put the wrap through your fingers make sure that it doesn't chafe because when you start hitting the bag if it shapes that's not going to be good so you're gonna go through pinky and ring finger first then ring finger middle finger second and then you're gonna go middle finger index finger third right once you do that you're gonna go back around your wrist well then you're gonna wrap it one more time and now as you get to the end of your wrap it's time to close it off so you're gonna wrap around your palm a few more times depending on how big your hands are you might be only able to do it this two times my hands are relatively small so I can go three times and after you go three times you go back around your wrist and you seal it off with this fat piece of hayabousa velcro and now your hands are ready to be put in in gloves start doing some bag work or you look like a mummy a little bit you can go out for Halloween if you if you dig a wrap is more or less a wrap there's not a whole lot that you can do to a piece of fabric to you know make it stand out exponentially more than another piece of fabric what I do really like is that Hayabusa does have that this side up note on it and also the velcro is solid so those are two key features that I personally love and because both these wraps cost the same amount about ten bucks I'm going to choose the Hayabusa once every time plus they're a beautiful green color and silly as it may sound I like the color green and if you follow my channel you know that I'm a green smoothie enthusiast you know I have green water bottles I have green smoothies and now I have green wraps so long story short I like my hand wraps I would definitely recommend them and if you haven't already make sure you check out my other hayabusa product reviews I reviewed some headgear some shin guards and some boxing gloves and I'll put links to all of those videos in this video for more content that's just like this but completely different subscribe to my channel boo tanco films thanks for watching
